intro: Galium tenuissimum subsp. adrianopolitanum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and preference for specific habitats make it a notable species in ecological studies.
